hints.content:
The container is filled to $\maroonD{40} \text { mL}$.  

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 10 milliliters to 70 milliliters. Tick marks 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, and 70 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 10 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The medicine inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 40 milliliters. A line extends from the tick mark at 40 milliliters and is labeled 40 milliliters. !

hints.content:
We can find the number of days it will take John to finish the medicine by dividing the total amount of medicine in the container $(\maroonD{40} \text { mL})$ by the number of $\text{mL}$ in each dose $(\blueD{4} \text { mL})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The longer top rectangle is labeled 40. The shorter bottom rectangle is labeled 4. A curved bracket at the bottom of both rectangles is labeled question mark equal groups. !

hints.content: It will take John $\greenD{10 \text { days}}$ to finish the medicine.

question.content:
John's stomach feels sick!  The doctor gives John some medicine (shown below) and tells him to take $4$ milliliters every day until the medicine is finished.

[[☃ image 1]]

  
  **How many days will it take John to finish the medicine?**   

[[☃ input-number 1]] days

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 10 milliliters to 70 milliliters. Tick marks 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, and 70 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 10 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The medicine inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 40 milliliters. !
